argumentText:
ARGUMENT

| Step | Hyp | Ref | Expression |
|---|---|---|---|

| 1 |  | prsspw.1 | |- A e. _V |
| 2 |  | prsspw.2 | |- B e. _V |
| 3 | 1, 2 | #P_prss | |- ( ( A e. ~P C /\ B e. ~P C ) <-> { A , B } C_ ~P C ) |
| 4 | 1 | #P_elpw | |- ( A e. ~P C <-> A C_ C ) |
| 5 | 2 | #P_elpw | |- ( B e. ~P C <-> B C_ C ) |
| 6 | 4, 5 | #P_anbi12i | |- ( ( A e. ~P C /\ B e. ~P C ) <-> ( A C_ C /\ B C_ C ) ) |
| 7 | 3, 6 | #P_bitr3i | |- ( { A , B } C_ ~P C <-> ( A C_ C /\ B C_ C ) ) |
\
 An unordered pair belongs to the power class of a class iff each member belongs to the class.  (Contributed by NM, 10-Dec-2003.)  (Proof shortened by Andrew Salmon, 26-Jun-2011.)  Obsolete version of ~ prsspw as of 25-Mar-2020.  (New usage is discouraged.) (Proof modification is discouraged.)
